This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"First_Aid_Kit_(band)","to":"First Aid Kit (band)"}],"pages":{"27653926":{"pageid":27653926,"ns":0,"title":"First Aid Kit (band)","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Short description|Swedish folk duo}}\n{{use dmy dates|date=October 2017}}\n{{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians -->\n| name                = First Aid Kit\n| image               = File:Coachella18W1-208 (42057786281).jpg\n| image_size          = 300px\n| caption             = First Aid Kit performing live at [[Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival|Coachella]] in 2018\n| origin              = [[Svedmyra]], Stockholm, Sweden\n| genre               = {{flatlist|\n*[[Folk music|Folk]]\n*[[indie folk]]<ref name=\"Dolan\"/>\n*[[Americana (music)|Americana]]\n*[[country folk]]}}\n| years_active        = 2007\u2013present\n| label               = {{flatlist|\n*[[Rabid Records|Rabid]]\n*[[Wichita Recordings|Wichita]]\n*[[Columbia Records|Columbia]]}}\n| website             = {{URL|firstaidkitband.com}}\n| current_members     = {{plainlist|\n*Johanna S\u00f6derberg\n*Klara S\u00f6derberg\n}}\n}}\n'''First Aid Kit''' is a Swedish [[Folk music|folk]] duo consisting of the sisters Johanna and Klara S\u00f6derberg, born in 1990 and 1993 respectively.<ref name=\"bookofriends\"/> When performing live, they are accompanied by a drummer, a guitarist and a keyboard player. First Aid Kit started to become internationally known in 2008 with their YouTube uploaded cover of the [[Fleet Foxes]]' song \"Tiger Mountain Peasant Song\".<ref name=\"Dolan\">{{cite magazine|magazine=Rolling Stone|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/the-10-most-killer-cover-songs-of-the-past-decade-97886/|title=The 10 Most Killer Cover Songs of the Past Decade|last=Dolan|first=Jon|date=3 September 2013|access-date=1 February 2022}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.seattleglobalist.com/2012/03/13/stockholm-sisters-tribute-to-fleet-foxes-arrives-in-seattle/1559|title=Stockholm sisters' tribute to Fleet Foxes arrives in Seattle|last=Joko-Fujimoto|first=Claire|date=2012-03-13|website=The Seattle Globalist|access-date=26 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2008/dec/10/new-band-first-aid-kit|title=New band of the day \u2013 No 447: First Aid Kit|last=Lester|first=Paul|date=10 December 2008|website=the Guardian|access-date=2016-05-26}}</ref> In 2012 ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' magazine had their song \"Emmylou\" as 10th on their \"Single of the Year\" list.<ref name=\"Emmylou_RollingStone\">{{cite web|title=Rolling Stone Music: 50 Best Songs of 2012: First Aid Kit, 'Emmylou'|date=5 December 2012 |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/50-best-songs-of-2012-20121205/first-aid-kit-emmylou-19691231|publisher=Rollingstone.com|access-date=6 March 2014}}</ref> First Aid Kit has released five albums, four EPs and several singles. In [[Brit Awards 2015|2015]], they were nominated for a [[Brit Awards|Brit Award]] as one of the five [[Brit Award for International Group|best international groups]].<ref name=\"Brit2015\">{{cite web |url=http://www.brits.co.uk/winners/ |title=The Brit Awards winners 2015 (archived) |date=25 February 2015 |access-date=22 September 2017 |url-status=bot: unknown |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150227214946/http://www.brits.co.uk/winners/ |archive-date=27 February 2015}}</ref> They were nominated again in [[Brit Awards 2019|2019]] and [[Brit Awards 2023|2023]].<ref name=\"Brit2019\">{{cite web|url=https://www.brits.co.uk/nominees|title=Brit Awards 2019 Vote for your favourite|work=brits.co.uk|access-date=12 January 2019|archive-date=11 January 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200111194725/https://www.brits.co.uk/nominees|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref name=\"Brit2023\">{{cite web|url = https://www.brits.co.uk/news/2023-international-group-of-the-year-nominees-announced|title= 2023 International Group of the Year nominees announced |work=brits.co.uk|access-date=12 January 2023}}</ref>\n\n==Early history==\nSisters Johanna (born 31 October 1990) and Klara (born 8 January 1993) S\u00f6derberg are from [[Enskede-\u00c5rsta-Vant\u00f6r|Enskede]], in [[Stockholm]].<ref name=\"bookofriends\">{{cite web|title=Book of friends, Swedish Radio P3, 9 July 2013 |url=http://static-cdn.sr.se/sida/images/3849/2909375_1200_674.jpg |publisher=Sverigesradio.se |access-date=22 September 2017}}</ref> Their father Benkt S\u00f6derberg was a member of the Swedish rock pop band [[Lolita Pop]],<ref name=\"SommarP1\">{{cite web|url=http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=2071&artikel=5127784|title=Klara och Johanna S\u00f6derberg - Sommar & Vinter i P1, 8 July 2012|publisher=Sveriges Radio|date=2012-07-08|access-date=2015-04-05}}</ref>{{rp|at=3:20\u20134:03}} but quit before Johanna was born and became a teacher of history and religion.<ref name=\"Radar\" /> Their mother teaches cinematography.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/rockandpopfeatures/9678475/First-Aid-Kit-interview-musical-pain-relief.html|title=First Aid Kit interview: musical pain relief|date=20 November 2012|publisher=telegraph.co.uk|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref>\n\nFrom childhood, Klara and Johanna were eager singers, giving concerts using a [[jump rope]] as a pretend microphone.<ref name=\"SommarP1\" />{{rp|at=0:40\u20132:40}} Klara's favorite songs were [[Judy Garland]]'s songs from ''[[The Wizard of Oz (1939 film)|The Wizard of Oz]]'' and [[Billie Holiday]]'s version of \"[[Gloomy Sunday]]\", which she sang without much understanding of the English lyrics.<ref name=\"Sonic2011\">{{cite web|url = http://sonicmagazine.com/2018/03/25/tvarsemot-tiden/|title= Tv\u00e4rsemot tiden (originally published in Sonic #60 in December 2011)|date=March 25, 2015|publisher=sonicmagazine.com|access-date=February 1, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160306053316/http://www.sonicmagazine.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=4788&Itemid=117&mosmsg=Item+saved+successfully |archive-date=6 March 2016}}</ref> Klara wrote her first song, \"Femton mil i min Barbiebil\" [Fifteen [[Scandinavian mile|Scandinavian miles]] in my Barbie car], when she was six.<ref name=\"gulliga\">{{cite web|url = http://www.svd.se/first-aid-kit-vill-inte-vara-gulliga_1143199|title= First Aid Kit vill inte vara gulliga|date=17 April 2008|publisher=svd.se|access-date=6 December 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150723131112/http://www.svd.se/first-aid-kit-vill-inte-vara-gulliga_1143199|archive-date=23 July 2015}}</ref>\n\nKlara and Johanna both attended the [[Internationella Engelska Skolan]] ( International English School ) of Enskede.<ref name=\"School\">{{cite news|title=First Aid Kit tillbaka d\u00e4r allt b\u00f6rjade, 27 March 2012|newspaper=Dagens Nyheter |date=27 March 2012 |url=http://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/musik/first-aid-kit-tillbaka-dar-allt-borjade/|publisher=dn.se|access-date=12 April 2015}}</ref> Klara applied for admission to [[Adolf Fredrik's Music School]], but was not accepted.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/musik/succesystrarna-fran-svedmyra/|title=Succ\u00e9systrarna fr\u00e5n Svedmyradate=19 January 2010|publisher=dn.se|access-date=7 December 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160412162900/http://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/musik/succesystrarna-fran-svedmyra/|archive-date=12 April 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Klara S\u00f6derberg: \"Jag kom inte in p\u00e5 musikskolan\", 14 October 2014|url=http://www.svt.se/skavlan/first-aid-kit-och-lena-endre-i-skavlan/|publisher=Sveriges Television|access-date=12 April 2015}}</ref>\n\nIn 2005, when Klara was 12, a friend introduced her to the band [[Bright Eyes (band)|Bright Eyes]].<ref name=\"Sonic2011\" /> This led her to country and folk music stars such as [[Johnny Cash]], [[Bob Dylan]], [[Leonard Cohen]], the [[Carter Family]], [[Louvin Brothers]], [[Townes Van Zandt]], [[Gram Parsons]] and [[Emmylou Harris]]. The same year, she received a guitar as a Christmas present<ref name=\"Radar\">{{cite web|title=Interview in Under The Radar, 18 October 2010|url=http://www.undertheradarmag.com/interviews/first_aid_kit/|publisher=Undertheradarmag.com|access-date=13 May 2014}}</ref> and quickly learned to play it.\n\nJohanna enjoyed a wide range of music, from [[Britney Spears]] to [[Techno|German techno]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Interview in It's Nice That, 16 April 2015|url=http://www.itsnicethat.com/articles/first-aid-kit|publisher=itsnicethat.com|access-date=19 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Interview in Mashable, 16 October 2014|date=16 October 2014 |url=http://mashable.com/2014/10/16/first-aid-kit-band/|publisher=Mashable.com|access-date=23 October 2014}}</ref> When she saw the film ''[[O Brother, Where Art Thou?]]'' and listened to its soundtrack, she was inspired to sing \"[[Down in the River to Pray]]\" with Klara. Fascinated by the result, the two began to sing together, first at home and then as street singers in the [[Stockholm metro]] and in front of liquor stores.<ref name=\"SommarP1\" />{{rp|at=16:10\u201317:55}}<ref name=\"WorldCafe2015\">{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/world-cafe/2015/07/31/428150148/world-cafe-sense-of-place-stockholm-first-aid-kit|title=Interview (audio): World Cafe Sense Of Place \u2014 Stockholm: First Aid Kit, 31 July 2015|publisher=WXPN & npr.org|access-date=2015-08-02}}</ref>{{rp|at=2:55-4:35}} Klara chose the name for their band at age 13 by looking through a dictionary. She found the term \"first aid kit\" and thought it best described what she wanted her music to be.<ref name=\"Radar\" />\n\nKlara and Johanna began to write their own country-folk songs inspired by [[Devendra Banhart]] and [[CocoRosie]], among others,<ref name=\"Sonic2011\" /> without much influence from their parents, who were fonder of [[Patti Smith]], [[Velvet Underground]] and the [[Pixies (band)|Pixies]].<ref name=\"Radar\" /> Their father has said that he was astonished and a little jealous of the ease his daughters had in producing their music.<ref>{{cite web|title=S\u00e5 \u00e4r det att ha en popstj\u00e4rna som barn, 21 March 2011|url=http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=4067&artikel=4413437|access-date=4 April 2015}}</ref>{{rp|at=8:20\u20138:55}} The most important advice their father gave them was to sing so loud that even somebody behind a wall could hear it.<ref name=\"Sonic2011\" />\n\n==Career==\n\n===2007\u20132009: Beginnings and ''Drunken Trees'' EP===\nIn April 2007, the sisters began to upload their self-made songs to the social networking site [[MySpace]].<ref name=\"gulliga\" /> They also sent a demo of their song \"Tangerine\" to  Swedish radio.<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit at Wichita website in 2009 (archived) |url=http://www.wichita-recordings.com/index.php/artists/detail/first_aid_kit/ |access-date=21 September 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090118014829/http://www.wichita-recordings.com/index.php/artists/detail/first_aid_kit/ |archive-date=January 18, 2009 }}</ref> It immediately went on air and was listed as one of the best songs of the summer 2007,<ref>{{cite web|title=B\u00e4st juli 2007 (archived)|url=http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=2945&artikel=1473208|publisher=sverigesradio.se|access-date=19 April 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304000935/http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=2945&artikel=1473208 |archive-date=4 March 2016}}</ref> which led to requests for live performances and even some offers from record companies. The first official performance as First Aid Kit was at PUNKTmedis library in Stockholm on 6 October.<ref name=\"School\" /><ref>{{cite web|title=Stor publik p\u00e5 PUNKTdemo 6 oktober|url=http://punktmedis.blogspot.fi/2007/10/|publisher=PUNKTmedis|access-date=4 September 2017}}</ref> More performances followed, but as Klara was 14 and still at school, they could only play during weekends.\n\nCoincidentally, their younger brother attended the same kindergarten as the daughter of [[Karin Dreijer]], half of Swedish electronic duo [[The Knife]], also known as [[Fever Ray]].<ref name=\"gulliga\" /> Their mother asked Dreijer to check out her daughters' songs on MySpace.<ref name=\"Sonic2011\" /> The band subsequently signed with [[Rabid Records]], a label co-owned by The Knife, with conditions that allowed the duo to have full control over their music and album art.<ref name=\"Radar\" />\n\nIn April 2008, the band released their debut EP ''[[Drunken Trees]]'' in Sweden, and made their first appearance on Swedish TV.<ref name=\"gulliga\" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rabidrecords.com:80/firstaidkit/default.html|title=First Aid Kit|publisher=rabidrecords.com|access-date=7 December 2017|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080328230710/http://www.rabidrecords.com/firstaidkit/default.html|archive-date=28 March 2008}}</ref> The EP was produced by their father, and was a re-recorded collection of songs from their MySpace, originally entitled \"Cross Oceans\".\n\nThe duo was relatively well known in Sweden by August 2008, when they uploaded a cover version of \"Tiger Mountain Peasant Song\" by [[Fleet Foxes]] to YouTube. [[Robin Pecknold]], frontman and lead guitarist for Fleet Foxes, praised the cover on his band's webpage, causing a surge in popularity for the video.<ref name=\"Radar\" /><ref name=\"SommarP1\" />{{rp|at=32:40-34:30}} This exposure led to international recognition, and by the end of 2008, the duo had signed a record deal with [[Wichita Records]].\n\n[[File:First Aid Kit Wiesbaden 2009 double.jpg|thumb|right|Johanna (left) and Klara S\u00f6derberg in [[Wiesbaden]] in 2009]]\nDue to international touring, Johanna quit high school in the autumn of 2008 (and Klara never started).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DtE9P57vBAA  |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211215/DtE9P57vBAA |archive-date=2021-12-15 |url-status=live|title=LADYGUNN TV / First Aid Kit Interview |date=20 April 2014 |publisher=YouTube |access-date=2014-06-06}}{{cbignore}}</ref> Their father took a leave from his job as a teacher and accompanied them on tour. First Aid Kit's first show outside [[Scandinavia]] took place on 22 November 2008 at the [[Crossing Border Festival]] in Netherlands. Fleet Foxes performed the day before, and when Pecknold spotted the duo standing at the edge of the stage, they were spontaneously asked to join to sing \"Tiger Mountain Peasant Song\".<ref name=\"SommarP1\" />{{rp|at=34:30\u201335:10}}<ref name=\"WorldCafe2015\" />{{rp|at=6:15\u20137:35}}\n\nWichita re-released ''Drunken Trees'' on 23 February 2009 as an enhanced EP, with \"Tiger Mountain Peasant Song\" added as a bonus track, along with several videos.\n\n===2010\u20132011: ''The Big Black and the Blue''===\nThe duo released their first album, ''[[The Big Black and the Blue]]'' on 1 February 2010.<ref>{{cite web |title=The Big Black And The Blue (Limited Edition CD) |url=http://www.wichita-recordings.com:80/shop/music/the-big-black-and-the-blue-2.html |access-date=6 December 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100410162919/http://www.wichita-recordings.com/shop/music/the-big-black-and-the-blue-2.html |archive-date=10 April 2010}}</ref> As with the ''Drunken Trees'' EP, the album was again produced by their father. The release was followed by an extensive tour throughout the United States, Canada, Australia, New Zealand and parts of Europe, including [[Primavera Sound Festival]] in [[Barcelona]].<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit redo f\u00f6r stora genomslaget|date=28 December 2011 |url=http://www.helagotland.se/noje/first-aid-kit-redo-for-stora-genomslaget-7370083.aspx|publisher=Helagotland.se|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit ready to save America this fall|date=25 July 2010 |url=https://consequence.net/2010/07/first-aid-kit-ready-to-save-america-this-fall/|publisher=Consequence|access-date=1 February 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit Sunday 05 September - Saturday 11 September 2010|url=http://www.pennydrop.com.au/tour/first-aid-kit-5/|publisher=pennydrop.com.au|access-date=6 December 2017|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206204224/http://www.pennydrop.com.au/tour/first-aid-kit-5/|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit September 16, 2010 The Wine Cellar, Auckland|url=http://www.einsteinmusicjournal.co.nz/first-aid-kit-live-photos/|publisher=einsteinmusicjournal.co.nz|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=San Miguel Primavera Sound 2010 Tickets|url=http://www.primaverasound.es/noticiaSingle?id=238/|publisher=primaverasound.es|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref>\n\nOn 19 November 2009, Klara and Johanna met [[Conor Oberst]] after [[Monsters of Folk]]'s concert in Stockholm, and gave him a demo of their coming album.<ref>{{cite web|title=\"Vi \u00e4r inblandade i allt tillsammans\", 28 December 2011|date=28 December 2011 |url=https://www.expressen.se/noje/vi-ar-inblandade-i-allt-tillsammans/|publisher=expressen.se|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> Oberst watched the duo perform at the [[Austin City Limits Music Festival]] pre-party in Texas on 7 October 2010. At this concert, he was especially impressed by the duo's acoustic performance of Ghost Town, which the audience listened to in rapt silence. After meeting the duo, Oberst called [[Mike Mogis]] and asked him to see the duo's performance at the ACL Festival two days later, on October 9.<ref name=\"Sonic2011\" /> After watching this performance, Mogis offered to produce the duo's next album.<ref name=\"SommarP1\" />{{rp|at=29:20\u201331:20}}<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.svd.se/allt-stammer-for-first-aid-kit|title=Allt stammer f\u00f6r First Aid Kit|date=27 January 2012|publisher=svd.se|access-date=7 December 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160312104906/http://www.svd.se/allt-stammer-for-first-aid-kit|archive-date=12 March 2016}}</ref>\n\nTwo days later, on 11 October 2010, after playing a concert in [[Nashville]], the duo received a telephone call from [[Jack White (musician)|Jack White]], who asked the duo to visit his studio the next day.<ref name=\"Sonic2011\" /> The result was a vinyl single containing cover versions of [[Buffy Sainte-Marie]]'s \"[[Universal Soldier (song)|Universal Soldier]]\" and [[Mel London]]'s and [[Tampa Red]]'s \"[[It Hurts Me Too]]\". The single was released on White's [[Third Man Records]] label.<ref name=\"SommarP1\" />{{rp|at=35:30\u201336:55}}<ref>{{cite web|title=14 May 2014 First Aid Kit at Jo Whiley BBC Radio 2, (at 2:30 of the interview)|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p01z4wq7/|publisher=Bbc.co.uk|access-date=25 May 2014}}</ref>\n\nFirst Aid Kit performed at the [[Polar Music Prize]] gala on 30 August 2011 in Stockholm, where they performed the song \"[[Dancing Barefoot]]\" for the winner [[Patti Smith]]. Smith was moved to tears at the intense ending of the song.<ref name=\"SommarP1\" />{{rp|at=4:03\u20136:40}}\n\nJohanna, under the moniker ''MoA'', released song covers of K-Pop artists such as [[2NE1]] and [[4Minute]]<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-07-20 |title=The Swedish Composer Behind HyunA's New Single \"Nabillera\" Actually Has A Surprising (Now Deleted) History With The K-Pop World |url=https://www.koreaboo.com/stories/composer-hyuna-new-nabillera-surprising-kpop-world/ |access-date=2023-02-22 |website=Koreaboo |language=en-US}}</ref> during 2010 to 2011. The covers were deleted after her identity was inadvertently revealed.\n\n===2012\u20132013: ''The Lion's Roar''===\n[[File:First Aid Kit (Frankfurt am Main, 18.02.2012).jpg|thumb|left|First Aid Kit (Frankfurt am Main, 18 February 2012)]]\nIn January 2012, the band released their second album, ''[[The Lion's Roar (album)|The Lion's Roar]]'', produced by [[Mike Mogis]]. The album was critically acclaimed, debuting at number one in Sweden and number 35 in the UK. The duo toured extensively in support of the album, including performances at several major festivals.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2517105/lollapalooza-2012-friday/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206203450/http://www.mtv.com/news/2517105/lollapalooza-2012-friday/|url-status=dead|archive-date=6 December 2017|title=First Aid Kit talks festival essentials and more at Lollapalooza 2012|date=4 August 2012|publisher=mtv.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://diymag.com/archive/bestival-2012-first-aid-kit|title=Bestival 2012: First Aid Kit|date=12 September 2012|publisher=diymag.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.clashmusic.com/live/berlin-festival-2012|title=Berlin Festival 2012|date=19 September 2012|publisher=clashmusic.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.austinchronicle.com/music/2012-10-19/acl-live-shot-first-aid-kit/|title=ACL Live Shot: First Aid Kit|date=19 October 2012|publisher=austinchronicle.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> The duo performed the song \"Emmylou\" on ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' in April 2012,<ref>{{Cite web|date=17 April 2012|title=Watch First Aid Kit Play \"Emmylou\" On Conan|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2012/04/watch-first-aid-kit-play-emmylou-on-conan.html|access-date=6 December 2017|publisher=pastemagazine.com|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206213953/https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2012/04/watch-first-aid-kit-play-emmylou-on-conan.html|url-status=dead}}</ref> and on [[Late Show with David Letterman|''The Late Show with David Letterman'']] in October 2012.<ref>{{cite web|title=IMDb|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3323384/|access-date=18 January 2014|publisher=IMDb.com}}</ref> \n\nOn 28 August 2012, they performed \"[[America (Simon & Garfunkel song)|America]]\" for the Polar Music Prize winner [[Paul Simon]], who gave the duo a standing ovation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://time.com/3591929/first-aid-kit-america-video/|title=Watch First Aid Kit Travel the Country in 'America' Video|date=18 November 2014|publisher=time.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref>\n\n[[File:First Aid Kit p\u00e5 Grammisgalan 2013.jpg|thumb|upright=.8|Johanna and Klara S\u00f6derberg at the [[Grammis|Swedish Grammis Awards]] in 2013]]\n\nThe song \"The Lion's Roar\" was featured in episode 2 of series 4 of ''[[Misfits (TV series)|Misfits]]'',<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.misfitsmusic.co.uk/php/season4/misfits_season4_episode_2.php|title=Misfits Series 4: Episode 2 Playlist|publisher=misfitsmusic.co.uk|access-date=6 December 2017|archive-date=1 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171201114455/http://www.misfitsmusic.co.uk/php/season4/misfits_season4_episode_2.php|url-status=dead}}</ref> and in the opening sequence of the video game \"[[The Long Dark]]\". \"In the Hearts of Men\" was featured in episode 21 of season 8 of ''[[Bones (TV series)|Bones]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.tunefind.com/show/bones/season-8/14102|title=Bones S8, E21 The Maiden in the Mushrooms|publisher=tunefind.com|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> The song \"I Found a Way\" appeared in the second episode of the [[Dontnod Entertainment]]'s 2019 video game ''[[Life Is Strange 2]]'' in 2019.\n\nIn November 2012, the duo received awards for \"Composer of the year\" and \"Breakthrough of the Year\" from the Swedish Music Publishers Association.<ref>{{cite web|title=Musikf\u00f6rl\u00e4ggarnas pris - Resultat & bilder 2012|url=http://musikforlaggarna.se/musikforlaggarnas-pris/resultat-bilder/?yearly=2012|publisher=Musikf\u00f6rl\u00e4ggarna|access-date=12 November 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141218025532/http://musikforlaggarna.se/musikforlaggarnas-pris/resultat-bilder/?yearly=2012|archive-date=18 December 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref> The song \"Emmylou\" was listed at 10th position by ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' magazine in their \"Single of the Year\" list of 2012.<ref name=\"Emmylou_RollingStone\"/> In February 2013, First Aid Kit was awarded the [[Nordic Music Prize]] for Best Nordic 2012 Album.<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit wins the third annual Nordic Music Prize! (archived) |url=http://nordicmusicprize.com/ |publisher=Nordicmusicprize.com |access-date=12 May 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140518112144/http://nordicmusicprize.com/ |archive-date=18 May 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=S\u00f8strene vant nordisk albumpris|url=http://www.aftenposten.no/incoming/Sostrene-vant-nordisk-albumpris-7121987.html|publisher=Aftenposten.no|access-date=15 February 2013}}</ref> They were also awarded four Swedish [[Grammis]] awards for 2012 \"Artist of the Year\", \"Songwriter of the Year\", \"Best Pop of the Year\" and \"Album of the Year\".<ref>{{cite web|title=First Aid Kit Win 4 Grammis! |url=http://www.wichita-recordings.com/news/first-aid-kit-win-4-grammis |access-date=4 April 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201133837/http://www.wichita-recordings.com/news/first-aid-kit-win-4-grammis |archive-date=1 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Grammisvinnarna genom \u00e5ren|url=http://grammis.se/om-grammis/grammisvinnarna-genom-aren/|publisher=Grammis.se|access-date=22 September 2017}}</ref>\n\n===2014\u20132016: ''Stay Gold''===\n[[File:First Aid Kit - Ruisrock 2014-07-06.jpg|thumb|left|First Aid Kit at [[Ruisrock]] 6 July 2014]]\n\nTheir third studio album, ''[[Stay Gold (First Aid Kit album)|Stay Gold]]'', was released on 10 June 2014 through [[Columbia Records]].<ref>{{cite tweet|user=ColumbiaRecords|author=Columbia Records|number=450643939285286912|date=31 March 2014|title=.@FirstAidKitBand's \"Stay Gold\" hits stores June 10th. Pre-order now & get an instant download of \"My Silver Lining\"}}</ref> The band released two singles from the album: \"[[My Silver Lining (First Aid Kit song)|My Silver Lining]]\" and \"Cedar Lane\".<ref>{{cite web|title=My Silver Lining Single|url=http://www.indieshuffle.com/first-aid-kit-my-silver-lining/|publisher=Indieshuffle.com|access-date=31 March 2014}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.scandipop.co.uk/first-aid-kit-cedar-lane/|title=First Aid Kit: 'Cedar Lane'|date=6 May 2014|publisher=scandipop.co.uk|access-date=6 December 2017}}</ref> As a result, the duo again received the \"Composer of the year\" prize from the Swedish Music Publishers Association.<ref>{{cite web|title=Musikf\u00f6rl\u00e4ggarnas pris - Resultat & bilder 2014|url=http://musikforlaggarna.se/musikforlaggarnas-pris/resultat-bilder/?yearly=2014|publisher=Musikf\u00f6rl\u00e4ggarna|access-date=12 April 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160311085652/http://musikforlaggarna.se/musikforlaggarnas-pris/resultat-bilder/?yearly=2014|archive-date=11 March 2016|url-status=dead}}</ref> In January 2015, First Aid Kit was nominated for the [[2015 Brit Awards]] in the Best International Group category as one of five nominees,<ref name=\"Brit2015\" /> and won the \"Best group of the year\" prize in the [[Sveriges Radio P3|Swedish Radio P3]] Gold Gala.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://sverigesradio.se/sida/gruppsida.aspx?programid=3964&grupp=21828&artikel=6070322/|title= \u00c5rets grupp: First Aid Kit|date=17 January 2015|language=sv|access-date=18 January 2015}}</ref> In the same month, the band was featured on a Swedish postage stamp.<ref>{{cite web|title=Swedish pop exports on postage stamps|url=http://www.postnord.com/en/media/press-releases/postnord/2014/swedish-pop-exports-avicii-and-robyn-on-postage-stamps/|publisher=Postnord|access-date=9 November 2014|archive-date=8 November The album ''Stay Gold'' was listed at number 6 in the [[Paste (magazine)|Paste magazine]]'s 40 best folk albums of the 2010s list.<ref>{{cite web|date=22 November 2019|title=The 40 Best Folk Albums of the 2010s|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2019/11/best-folk-albums-of-the-2010s.html|access-date=24 November 2019|work=pastemagazine.com}}</ref>\n\nFirst Aid Kit began touring again in May 2017|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\n===2017: Singles and resumed touring===\nAt the beginning of 2017 Klara and Johanna were at [[Flora Recording & Playback]] in Portland, Oregon, finishing their fourth album.\n\nIn early 2017, First Aid Kit provided backing vocals for Jesper Lindell's ''A Little Less Blue'' EP, which was produced by Sten Booberg and the duo's father, Benkt S\u00f6derberg.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://bloggar.aftonbladet.se/musikbloggen/2017/02/first-aid-kit-jesper-lindell-moving-slow/|title= First Aid Kit om Jesper Lindell: '\u00d6nskar vi skrivit l\u00e5ten!'|date= 10 February 2017|publisher=Aftonbladet|access-date=21 February 2017}}</ref> The EP was released on 21 April 2017.<ref name=\"A Little Less Blue\">{{cite web|url = https://www.mynewsdesk.com/se/bmg-scandinavia/pressreleases/first-aid-kit-gaestar-paa-jesper-lindells-efterlaengtade-debut-ep-1881544|title= First Aid Kit g\u00e4star p\u00e5 Jesper Lindells efterl\u00e4ngtade debut-EP!|date= 28 March 2017|publisher=BMG Scandinavia|access-date=4 April 2017}}</ref>\n\n[[File:First Aid Kit - Leonard Cohen tribute Concert - Dramaten Stockholm March 13 2017.jpg|thumb|First Aid Kit at their Leonard Cohen tribute concert in Dramaten, Stockholm, Sweden 13 March 2017]]\n\nOn 10 March, First Aid Kit released a new single, \"You Are the Problem Here\", for [[International Woman's Day]]. The band called the song an angry song, inspired by yet another story of a man getting off easy after raping a woman. The track was produced and mixed by Tucker Martine from [[Flora Recording & Playback]] studio.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.out.com/music/2017/3/08/first-aid-kits-you-are-problem-here-rips-apart-rape-apologists|title= First Aid Kit's 'You Are the Problem Here' Rips Apart Rape Apologists|date= 8 March 2017|publisher=Out Magazine|access-date=11 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/hear-first-aid-kits-vengeful-new-song-you-are-the-problem-here-w471010|title= Hear First Aid Kit's 'Vengeful' New Song 'You Are the Problem Here'|date= 8 March 2017|publisher=Rolling Stone|access-date=11 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=exsaCN4c5dc|title= First Aid Kit - You Are The Problem Here (Lyric Video)|date= 11 March 2017|publisher=Jagadambarecords|access-date=11 March 2017}}</ref> A 7-inch vinyl copy of \"You Are the Problem Here\" was released on [[Record Store Day]] 2018. All profits from the song are donated to [[Women for Women International]].<ref>{{cite web|url = https://recordstoreday.com/SpecialRelease/10155|title= First Aid Kit - You are the problem here|work=recordstoreday.com|access-date=22 April 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.longlivevinyl.net/first-aid-kit-to-release-you-are-the-problem-here-7-for-record-store-day/|title= First Aid Kit to release You Are The Problem Here 7\" for Record Store Day|work=longlivevinyl.net|date= 8 March 2018|access-date=22 April 2018}}</ref>\n\nFirst Aid Kit held four [[Leonard Cohen]]-themed concerts in Spring 2017 with their friends in [[Royal Dramatic Theatre|Dramaten]], Stockholm, Sweden.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://bloggar.aftonbladet.se/musikbloggen/2017/03/first-aid-kit-gor-suveran-cohen-hyllning/|title= First Aid Kit g\u00f6r suver\u00e4n Cohen-hyllning|date= 14 March 2017|publisher=Aftonbladet|access-date=15 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.dramaten.se/repertoar/First-aid-kit-leonard-cohen/|title= First Aid Kit och v\u00e4nner: en hyllning till Leonard Cohen|publisher=Dramaten|access-date=27 April 2017}}</ref> Their concert on 13 March was filmed by [[Sveriges Television]], and broadcast on 14 and 15 October by SVT2.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://vipatv.svt.se/204/kronikor/arkiv-for-kronikor/2017-03-17-alla-i-sverige-far-hora-first-aid-kit---tack-vare-svt.html|title= Alla i Sverige f\u00e5r h\u00f6ra First Aid Kit - tack vare SVT|publisher=SVT|access-date=18 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.svtplay.se/first-aid-kit-tolkar-cohen-pa-dramaten|title= First Aid Kit tolkar Cohen p\u00e5 Dramaten|publisher=SVT|access-date=15 October 2017}}</ref> An audio recording of the concert was released on 26 March 2021.<ref name=\"WhoByFire_NME\">{{cite web|url = https://www.nme.com/en_asia/news/music/first-aid-kit-announce-live-leonard-cohen-tribute-album-share-version-of-suzanne-2890697 |title= First Aid Kit announce live Leonard Cohen tribute album, share version of 'Suzanne' |publisher=NME|date=27 February 2021|access-date=2 March 2021}}</ref>\n\nOn Record Store Day 2017, [[Third Man Records]] published the book ''The Blue Series: The Story Behind the Color'', which contains a story by Johanna and Klara about recording songs in [[Jack White]]'s studio, and a 7-inch split blue vinyl single with the band's previously unreleased cover of \"[[Gloomy Sunday]]\". The record store day issue was limited to 500 copies. A regular release on black vinyl single was released on 6 June.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://thirdmanrecords.com/news/record-store-day-2017/|title=Record Store Day 2017|publisher=Third Man Records|access-date=28 April 2017|archive-date=27 April 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170427092050/https://thirdmanrecords.com/news/record-store-day-2017/|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\nJohanna and Klara sang several songs with [[H\u00e5kan Hellstr\u00f6m]] at concerts on 9 and 10 June at [[Stockholm Olympic Stadium]], and on 28 and 29 July at [[Ullevi]] stadium in Gothenburg. On 25 August, H\u00e5kan Hellstr\u00f6m published a live recording of \"Du Fria\" in digital format.<ref name=\"Du Fria\">{{cite web|url = http://www.festivalrykten.se/hakan-hellstrom-slapper-livelat-med-silvana-imam-och-first-aid-kit/|title= H\u00e5kan Hellstr\u00f6m sl\u00e4pper livel\u00e5t med Silvana Iman och First Aid Kit|publisher=Festivalrykten|access-date=25 August 2017}}</ref>\n\nFirst Aid Kit resumed touring in Summer 2017, beginning with a concert on 16 June in [[Borgholm, Sweden]].<ref>{{cite performance at Glastonbury Festival on 23 June,<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/events/ec584f/acts/a6hxp6|title= First Aid Kit at Glastonbury 2017|publisher=BBC|access-date=6 July 2017}}</ref> during which they performed two songs from their upcoming album [[Ruins (First Aid Kit album)|''Ruins'']]: \"Fireworks\" and \"It's a Shame\".<ref>{{cite The album was recorded at [[Flora Recording & Playback]] in Portland, Oregon,<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.instagram.com/p/BPVn9C0FJ4q/|title= Portland, Oregon|publisher=First Aid Kit, Listen|work=Pitchfork|last=Wicks|first=Amanda|date=27 January 2017|access-date=28 October 2017}}</ref> The album was certified Gold in Sweden in August, and Silver in the UK in November.<ref Records in partnership with Gutsy Animations to release Moominvalley soundtrack |work=gutsy.fi|date=22 February 2019|access-date=12 May 2019}}</ref>\n\nOn May 18 2019, the duo canceled all planned 2019 summer dates due to unforeseen medical circumstances.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.nme.com/news/music/first-aid-kit-cancel-summer-tour-dates-due-unforeseen-medical-circumstances-2489741 |title= First Aid Kit cancel all summer tour dates due to \"unforeseen medical circumstances\" |work=nme.com|date=19 May 2019|access-date=19 May 2019}}</ref> It was later revealed that the concerts were canceled because Klara was experiencing burnout.<ref name=\"Kristianstadsbladet2019\">{{cite web|url = http://www.kristianstadsbladet.se/nyheter/first-aid-kit-kravs-mod-att-tacka-nej/ |title= First Aid Kit: \"Kr\u00e4vs mod att tacka nej\" |work=kristianstadsbladet.se|date=13 December 2019|access-date=26 December 2019}}</ref><ref name=\"Femina2020\">{{cite web|url = https://www.femina.se/intervju/first-aid-kit-klara-om-utbrandheten-allt-kraschade-jag-kom-inte-ur-sangen/3264800 |title= First Aid Kit-Klara om utbr\u00e4ndheten: \"Allt kraschade, jag kom inte ur s\u00e4ngen\" |work=Femina|date=25 September 2020|access-date=24 November 2020}}</ref>\n\nKlara wrote \"Strange Beauty\" after the suicide of [[David Berman (musician)|David Berman]]. The track was published on August 22, along with their cover of ''\"''Random Rules\" by Berman's band [[Silver Jews]].<ref name=\"BermanCovers\">{{cite web|url = http://www.mynewsdesk.com/se/sonybmg/pressreleases/first-aid-kit-slaepper-tvaa-laatar-som-en-hyllning-till-silver-jews-nyligen-avlidne-frontman-david-berman-2908656 |title= First Aid Kit sl\u00e4pper tv\u00e5 l\u00e5tar som en hyllning till Silver Jews nyligen avlidne frontman David Berman |work=sonybmg|date=22 August 2019|access-date=22 August 2019}}</ref>\n\nOn 16 October 2019, the duo received the [[Ulla Billquist]] scholarship, which is awarded each year to female artists who enrich the Swedish music scene through their artistry.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.folketshusochparker.se/first-aid-kit-ar-2019-ars-ulla-billquist-stipendiat/ |title= First aid kit \u00e4r 2019 \u00e5rs Ulla Billquist stipendiat |work= Folkets Hus och Parker |date=16 October 2019|access-date=17 October 2019}}</ref>\n\nOn 11 December, First Aid Kit played three songs at the Swedish TV's charity program [[Musikhj\u00e4lpen]] with [[Maja Francis]].<ref>{{cite news|url = https://www.svt.se/nyheter/lokalt/vastmanland/har-hyllar-first-aid-kit-artisten-marie-fredriksson-live-i-musikhjalpen |title= H\u00e4r hyllar First Aid Kit artisten Marie Fredriksson live i Musikhj\u00e4lpen |newspaper= SVT Nyheter |date=11 December 2019|access-date=12 December 2019|last1=Gustavsson |first1=Robert }}</ref> First Aid Kit had Christmas-themed shows on December 17, 18 and 19 in Stockholm with [[Amanda Bergman]] and Maja Francis. <ref>{{cite web |url= https://sodrateatern.com/winter-is-blue/ |title= Winter is Blue - Julkonsert med First Aid Kit, Maja Francis och Amanda Bergman |work= Sodra Teatern |access-date= 25 October 2019 |archive-date= 25 October 2019 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20191025143916/https://sodrateatern.com/winter-is-blue/ |url-status= dead }}</ref><ref name=\"Kristianstadsbladet2019\" /><ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/musik/a/vQpQMX/stamsangen-plogar-bort-allt-motstand |title= St\u00e4ms\u00e5ngen plogar bort allt motst\u00e5nd - Julkonserten med First Aid Kit \u00e4r magisk |work=aftonbladet.se|date=18 December 2019|access-date=26 December 2019}}</ref>\n\n===2020\u20132021: Streams, covers and collaborations during COVID-19 pandemic===\n\nOn 13 January 2020, Johanna announced that she is expecting a baby in the summer<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/a/8m1ew1/first-aid-kit-sangerskan-ar-gravid |title= First aid kit-s\u00e5ngerskan \u00e4r gravid |work=aftonbladet.se|date=13 January 2020|access-date=14 January 2020}}</ref> A baby girl was born on 18 June.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.aftonbladet.se/nojesbladet/a/LAJ5Kp/first-aid-kit-stjarnan-har-fatt-barn |title= First aid kit-stj\u00e4rnan har f\u00e5tt barn |work=Aftonbladet|date=23 June 2020|access-date=23 June 2020}}</ref> On 16 January, Klara announced that she will start a country club in Stockholm with a house band.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.cafe.se/first-aid-kit-klara-och-sverrir-gudnason-startar-countryklubb-i-stockholm/ |title= First Aid Kit-Klara och Sverrir Gudnason startar countryklubb i Stockholm |work=cafe.se|date=16 January 2020|access-date=20 January 2020}}</ref> The first event was held on 21 February, right before the concert venues were closed due to the pandemic.<ref>{{cite news|url = https://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/lyckad-start-for-klara-soderbergs-egna-countryklubb/ |title= Lyckad start f\u00f6r Klara S\u00f6derbergs countryklubb |work=Dagens Nyheter|date=22 February 2020|access-date=25 February 2020}}</ref> During spring 2020 [[COVID-19 lockdowns]] the band streamed live concerts from Johanna's home.\n\nOn 14 August 2020, First Aid Kit released a cover version of [[Willie Nelson]]'s song \"[[On the Road Again (Willie Nelson song)|On the Road Again]]\". Proceeds from the song were donated to Crew Nation, to support crew members who were forced out of work due to [[COVID-19 pandemic]].<ref name=\"OnTheRoadAgain\">{{cite web|url = https://www.spin.com/2020/08/first-aid-kit-willie-nelson-on-the-road-again-cover/ |title= First Aid Kit Share Cover of Willie Nelson's 'On the Road Again' |work=spin.com|date=14 August 2020|access-date=25 August 2020}}</ref> On 25 September, they released two cover versions of [[Ted G\u00e4rdestad]]'s \"Come Give Me Love\", one sung with the original Swedish lyrics, and the other with their own translation of the lyrics into English.<ref name=\"ComeGiveMeLove\">{{cite web|url = ''Palomino'' and new backing band===\n\nOn 19 January 2022 First Aid Kit streamed Lion's Roar 10th anniversary concert from Mosebacke Etablissement, Stockholm with brothers Johannes and Gabriel Runemark who will be new band members.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sVnCgz-wwlA |title= First Aid Kit - The Lion's Roar 10th Anniversary Live Stream |work=First Aid Kit|date=19 charm the crowd with their invigorating folk music|website=BBC Music|date= 24 June 2022|accessdate=25 June 2022}}</ref> with Freja Drakenberg, Gabriel Runemark and Johannes Runemark. At the end of July they released a cover of [[Don Henley]]'s ''[[The Boys of Summer (song)|The Boys of Summer]]'' as a single in various streaming services.<ref name=\"BoysOfSummer-ourculture\">{{cite 2022|access-date=5 August 2022}}</ref> Second single, ''Out of My Head'' from the album was released on 12 August, the third one ''Turning Onto You'', on 30 September.<ref touring followed the album release.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://music.mxdwn.com/2022/11/06/news/first-aid-kit-announces-spring-summer-2023-tour-dates/ |title= First Aid Kit Announces Spring & Summer 2023 Tour Dates |work=music.mxdwn.com|date=6 November 2022|access-date=8 November 2022}}</ref> On 7 July 2023 deluxe edition of Palomino album was released with five new tracks added in streaming services and lyric video of ''Everybody's Got to Learn'' was published.<ref name=\"PalominoDeluxe\">{{cite web|url =
